externalDocs.description: 3GPP TS 29.510 V16.3.0; 5G System; Network Function Repository Services; Stage 3

apiRoot.description: apiRoot as defined in clause 4.4 of 3GPP TS 29.501

get.summary: Search a collection of NF Instances

parameters.name: Accept-Encoding
parameters.description: Accept-Encoding, described in IETF RFC 7231

parameters.name: target-nf-type
parameters.description: Type of the target NF

parameters.name: requester-nf-type
parameters.description: Type of the requester NF

parameters.name: requester-nf-instance-id
parameters.description: NfInstanceId of the requester NF

parameters.name: service-names
parameters.description: Names of the services offered by the NF

items.description: Service names known to NRF

parameters.name: requester-nf-instance-fqdn
parameters.description: FQDN of the requester NF

parameters.name: target-plmn-list
parameters.description: Id of the PLMN of the target NF

parameters.name: requester-plmn-list
parameters.description: Id of the PLMN where the NF issuing the Discovery request is located

parameters.name: target-nf-instance-id
parameters.description: Identity of the NF instance being discovered

parameters.name: target-nf-fqdn
parameters.description: FQDN of the NF instance being discovered

parameters.name: hnrf-uri
parameters.description: Uri of the home NRF

parameters.name: snssais
parameters.description: Slice info of the target NF

parameters.name: requester-snssais
parameters.description: Slice info of the requester NF

parameters.name: plmn-specific-snssai-list
parameters.description: PLMN specific Slice info of the target NF

items.description: List of network slices (S-NSSAIs) for a given PLMN ID

parameters.name: dnn
parameters.description: Dnn supported by the BSF, SMF or UPF

parameters.name: nsi-list
parameters.description: NSI IDs that are served by the services being discovered

parameters.name: tai
parameters.description: Tracking Area Identity

parameters.name: amf-region-id
parameters.description: AMF Region Identity

parameters.name: amf-set-id
parameters.description: AMF Set Identity

parameters.name: guami
parameters.description: Guami used to search for an appropriate AMF

parameters.name: supi
parameters.description: SUPI of the user

parameters.name: ue-ipv4-address
parameters.description: IPv4 address of the UE

parameters.name: ip-domain
parameters.description: IP domain of the UE, which supported by BSF

parameters.name: ue-ipv6-prefix
parameters.description: IPv6 prefix of the UE

parameters.name: pgw-ind
parameters.description: Combined PGW-C and SMF or a standalone SMF

parameters.name: pgw
parameters.description: PGW FQDN of a combined PGW-C and SMF

parameters.name: gpsi
parameters.description: GPSI of the user

parameters.name: external-group-identity
parameters.description: external group identifier of the user

parameters.name: internal-group-identity
parameters.description: internal group identifier of the user

parameters.name: pfd-data
parameters.description: PFD data

schema.description: List of Application IDs and/or AF IDs managed by a given NEF Instance

parameters.name: data-set
parameters.description: data set supported by the NF

schema.description: Types of data sets stored in UDR

parameters.name: routing-indicator
parameters.description: routing indicator in SUCI

parameters.name: group-id-list
parameters.description: Group IDs of the NFs being discovered

parameters.name: dnai-list
parameters.description: Data network access identifiers of the NFs being discovered

parameters.name: pdu-session-types
parameters.description: list of PDU Session Type required to be supported by the target NF

parameters.name: event-id-list
parameters.description: Analytics event(s) requested to be supported by the Nnwdaf_AnalyticsInfo service

anyOf.description: This string provides forward-compatibility with future extensions to the enumeration but is not used to encode content defined in the present version of this API.

items.description: Possible values are - LOAD_LEVEL_INFORMATION: Represent the analytics of load level information of corresponding network slice instance. - NETWORK_PERFORMANCE: Represent the analytics of network performance information. - NF_LOAD: Indicates that the event subscribed is NF Load. - SERVICE_EXPERIENCE: Represent the analytics of service experience information of the specific applications. - UE_MOBILITY: Represent the analytics of UE mobility. - UE_COMMUNICATION: Represent the analytics of UE communication. - QOS_SUSTAINABILITY: Represent the analytics of QoS sustainability information in the certain area.  - ABNORMAL_BEHAVIOUR: Indicates that the event subscribed is abnormal behaviour information. - USER_DATA_CONGESTION: Represent the analytics of the user data congestion in the certain area.

parameters.name: nwdaf-event-list
parameters.description: Analytics event(s) requested to be supported by the Nnwdaf_EventsSubscription service.

anyOf.description: This string provides forward-compatibility with future extensions to the enumeration but is not used to encode content defined in the present version of this API.

items.description: Possible values are - SLICE_LOAD_LEVEL: Indicates that the event subscribed is load level information of Network Slice instance - NETWORK_PERFORMANCE: Indicates that the event subscribed is network performance information. - NF_LOAD: Indicates that the event subscribed is load level and status of one or several Network Functions. - SERVICE_EXPERIENCE: Indicates that the event subscribed is service experience. - UE_MOBILITY: Indicates that the event subscribed is UE mobility information. - UE_COMMUNICATION: Indicates that the event subscribed is UE communication information. - QOS_SUSTAINABILITY: Indicates that the event subscribed is QoS sustainability. - ABNORMAL_BEHAVIOUR: Indicates that the event subscribed is abnormal behaviour. - USER_DATA_CONGESTION: Indicates that the event subscribed is user data congestion information.

parameters.name: supported-features
parameters.description: Features required to be supported by the target NF

parameters.name: upf-iwk-eps-ind
parameters.description: UPF supporting interworking with EPS or not

parameters.name: chf-supported-plmn
parameters.description: PLMN ID supported by a CHF

parameters.name: preferred-locality
parameters.description: preferred target NF location

parameters.name: access-type
parameters.description: AccessType supported by the target NF

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of NFProfiles to return in the response

parameters.name: required-features
parameters.description: Features required to be supported by the target NF

parameters.name: complex-query
parameters.description: the complex query condition expression

parameters.name: max-payload-size
parameters.description: Maximum payload size of the response expressed in kilo octets

parameters.name: atsss-capability
parameters.description: ATSSS Capability

parameters.name: upf-ue-ip-addr-ind
parameters.description: UPF supporting allocating UE IP addresses/prefixes

parameters.name: client-type
parameters.description: Requested client type served by the NF

parameters.name: lmf-id
parameters.description: LMF identification to be discovered

parameters.name: an-node-type
parameters.description: Requested AN node type served by the NF

parameters.name: rat-type
parameters.description: Requested RAT type served by the NF

parameters.name: preferred-tai
parameters.description: preferred Tracking Area Identity

parameters.name: preferred-nf-instances
parameters.description: preferred NF Instances

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Validator for conditional requests, as described in IETF RFC 7232, 3.2

parameters.name: target-snpn
parameters.description: Target SNPN Identity

parameters.name: af-ee-data
parameters.description: NEF exposured by the AF

schema.description: AF Event Exposure data managed by a given NEF Instance

parameters.name: w-agf-info
parameters.description: UPF collocated with W-AGF

parameters.name: tngf-info
parameters.description: UPF collocated with TNGF

parameters.name: twif-info
parameters.description: UPF collocated with TWIF

parameters.name: target-nf-set-id
parameters.description: Target NF Set ID

parameters.name: target-nf-service-set-id
parameters.description: Target NF Service Set ID

parameters.name: nef-id
parameters.description: NEF ID

parameters.name: notification-type
parameters.description: Notification Type

schema.description: Types of notifications used in Default Notification URIs in the NF Profile of an NF Instance

parameters.name: serving-scope
parameters.description: areas that can be served by the target NF

parameters.name: imsi
parameters.description: IMSI of the requester UE to search for an appropriate NF (e.g. HSS)

parameters.name: preferred-api-versions
parameters.description: Preferred API version of the services to be discovered

parameters.name: v2x-support-ind
parameters.description: PCF supports V2X

parameters.name: redundant-gtpu
parameters.description: UPF supports redundant gtp-u to be discovered

parameters.name: redundant-transport
parameters.description: UPF supports redundant transport path to be discovered

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

search.description: The 'searchId' parameter returned in the response can be used as the 'searchId' parameter in the GET request to '/searches/{searchId}'

completeSearch.description: The 'searchId' parameter returned in the response can be used as the 'searchId' parameter in the GET request to '/searches/{searchId}/complete'

Cache-Control.description: Cache-Control containing max-age, described in IETF RFC 7234, 5.2

ETag.description: Entity Tag containing a strong validator, described in IETF RFC 7232, 2.3

Location.description: The URI pointing to the resource located on the redirect target NRF

parameters.name: Accept-Encoding
parameters.description: Accept-Encoding, described in IETF RFC 7231

parameters.name: Accept-Encoding
parameters.description: Accept-Encoding, described in IETF RFC 7231

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

Cache-Control.description: Cache-Control containing max-age, described in IETF RFC 7234, 5.2

ETag.description: Entity Tag containing a strong validator, described in IETF RFC 7232, 2.3

SearchResult.description: Contains the list of NF Profiles returned in a Discovery response

StoredSearchResult.description: Contains a complete search result (i.e. a number of discovered NF Instances), stored by NRF as a consequence of a prior search result

NFProfile.description: Information of an NF Instance discovered by the NRF

nfStatus.description: Status of a given NF Instance stored in NRF

anyOf.description: This string provides forward-compatibility with future extensions to the enumeration but is not used to encode content defined in the present version of this API.

items.description: Possible values are - LOAD_LEVEL_INFORMATION: Represent the analytics of load level information of corresponding network slice instance. - NETWORK_PERFORMANCE: Represent the analytics of network performance information. - NF_LOAD: Indicates that the event subscribed is NF Load. - SERVICE_EXPERIENCE: Represent the analytics of service experience information of the specific applications. - UE_MOBILITY: Represent the analytics of UE mobility. - UE_COMMUNICATION: Represent the analytics of UE communication. - QOS_SUSTAINABILITY: Represent the analytics of QoS sustainability information in the certain area.  - ABNORMAL_BEHAVIOUR: Indicates that the event subscribed is abnormal behaviour information. - USER_DATA_CONGESTION: Represent the analytics of the user data congestion in the certain area.

items.description: Possible values are - SLICE_LOAD_LEVEL: Indicates that the event subscribed is load level information of Network Slice instance - NETWORK_PERFORMANCE: Indicates that the event subscribed is network performance information. - NF_LOAD: Indicates that the event subscribed is load level and status of one or several Network Functions. - SERVICE_EXPERIENCE: Indicates that the event subscribed is service experience. - UE_MOBILITY: Indicates that the event subscribed is UE mobility information. - UE_COMMUNICATION: Indicates that the event subscribed is UE communication information. - QOS_SUSTAINABILITY: Indicates that the event subscribed is QoS sustainability. - ABNORMAL_BEHAVIOUR: Indicates that the event subscribed is abnormal behaviour. - USER_DATA_CONGESTION: Indicates that the event subscribed is user data congestion information.
